edu.rit.util

Class RandomGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.RandomGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphSpec, java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>

    public class RandomGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphSpec
    Class RandomGraph is a GraphSpec object that specifies a random graph. Given a number of vertices V and a number of edges E, a RandomGraph object specifies a graph consisting of a randomly chosen subset of size E of all possible edges among V vertices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface edu.rit.util.GraphSpec

        GraphSpec.Edge

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomGraph

        public RandomGraph(int V,
           int E,
           long seed)
        Construct a random graph specification with the given seed.
        Parameters:
        V - Number of vertices.
        E - Number of edges.
        seed - Random seed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if V < 0. Thrown if E < 0. Thrown if E > V(V−1)/2.

      • RandomGraph

        public RandomGraph(int V,
           int E,
           Random prng)
        Construct a random graph specification with the given pseudorandom number generator.
        Parameters:
        V - Number of vertices.
        E - Number of edges.
        prng - Pseudorandom number generator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if V < 0. Thrown if E < 0. Thrown if E > V(V−1)/2.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if prng is null.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this graph specification. This restarts the iteration over the edges, such that calling hasNext() and next() will generate a fresh graph with the same number of vertices V and the same number of edges E.

        The reset() method in class RandomGraph will generate a fresh graph with different randomly chosen edges.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface GraphSpec

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Determine if there are more edges.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface GraphSpec
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
        Returns:
        True if there are more edges, false if not.

      • next

        public GraphSpec.Edge next()
        Get the next edge.

        Note: The next() method is permitted to return the same Edge object, with different vertices, on every call. Extract the vertices from the returned edge object and store them in another data structure; do not store a reference to the returned edge object itself.

        Specified by:
        next in interface GraphSpec
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<GraphSpec.Edge>
        Returns:
        Next edge.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if there are no more edges.
